answers.answer: Hi!I am sorry to hear about your medical problems. If you received post exposure vaccination within half an hour of bite, then it should be fully effective. Apart from disc problems in the back and anxiety and panic attacks, muscle spasms can be due to several causes. Dehydration and electrolyte imbalance, muscle fatigue, pinched nerve due to wrongI would suggest you get the blood levels of the following checked if they have not already been checked: potassium, calcium, sodium, magnesium, vitamin B complex, or vitamins B1, B3, or B6 and Vitamin D. Certain sleep disorders and peripheral nerve disorders due to diabetes, Lyme's, lupus or hypothyroidism can also be the cause.Please consult your doctor regarding this. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

question: Over a year ago I was bitten by a raccoon that I didn't see was right under my feet as I sat down on my deck it bit me out of fear but it lightly scratched my skin and I bled a little bit.. I immediately went to the hospital and got shots and did the full course of treatment .. I was wondering how effective the vaccine was I received treatment within a half hour of the biteIt is now a year later and have been having strange symptoms that none of my doctors could make sense of constant widespread twitching and heart palpitations anxiety and tingling
title: how effective is post exposure rabies vaccine?
